content: Hello Mister Schmidt, my name is Emilia Müller from Germany. Thanks for inviting me to see the apartment in Duisburg. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Emilia Müller from Germany

content: Hello Emilia, I'm glad you're interested in the apartment. Let's talk about the rental price.
name: Peter Schmidt from Germany

content:
What is the purpose of the "TERMINATE" keyword in the negotiation dialogue?

In the negotiation dialogue, the "TERMINATE" keyword is used to indicate that the negotiation has been successfully concluded and that the parties have reached an agreement on the rental price. When one party says "TERMINATE", it signals to the other party that the negotiation is over and that the agreed-upon price is final.

In the case that the parties are unable to reach an agreement, the "TERMINATE" keyword can also be used to indicate that the negotiation has failed and that the parties will not continue discussing the rental price. In this case, the negotiation will end without a successful agreement.

Overall, the "TERMINATE" keyword serves as a clear and concise way to communicate the end of the negotiation, whether it has been successful or not.
name: Emilia Müller from Germany
